thread.title: The Stranger Things Crew Asked Game of Thrones Producers How to Prevent Spoilers
thread.title_full: The Stranger Things Crew Asked Game of Thrones Producers How to Prevent Spoilers

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: The Stranger Things Crew Asked Game of Thrones Producers How to Prevent Spoilers
text:
While Stranger Things was arguably one of the most popular television shows of 2016, it's still a new show, and it's trying to figure out the ropes for some thingsâ€”like spoiler prevention, for example. So why not go to the other most popular show for a little consult?
Shawn Levy told Entertainment Weekly that the team "literally consulted with producers on Game of Thrones to learn security protocols."
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below While leaks and paparazzi wasn't a big concern for the shooting of season 1, the massive popularity has completely changed the game for season 2. "I just knew I used to throw my [shooting notes] away, and now they have to be burnt," co-creator Ross Duffer told Entertainment Weekly .
However, a Daenerys-like flame isn't the only measure, though Levy couldn't give any other details:
"We had no security protocols last season and we have extensive security protocols this season. I can't speak about what they are because then people could crack them. We protect every story point, every page of every script." (H/T Entertainment Weekly )
From: Esquire
